rename.from: Roles in annotation process with doccano
rename.to: Add Auditor roles in annotation process with doccano

rename.from: Add Auditor roles in annotation process with doccano
rename.to: Add Auditor roles in annotation process with doccano (low priority)

body:
This is a concept. We don't need to implement these from scratch.

# Design 1

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6737785/56017115-4691f380-5d39-11e9-8bbf-20b7f2e669fc.png)

# Design 2

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6737785/56017157-5dd0e100-5d39-11e9-8668-dab86271470a.png)

I go with design 1.  
It is more clear to directly incorporate `role_id` in `Member` class. The `MemberRole` class in design 2 is a little redundant. 

This structure is great. In such a design, it is very flexible to add more roles, permissions, and operations. The user can create a more custom annotation process depending on purposes.

issue.title: Login via command line

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
------------------------

I'm running Docanno via Docker in my local and everything is ok up and running

Whenever we login, we see the Django login screen before we can access the projects. We would like to be able to skip this step and login via the command line instead. This is so that we can have many anonymous users login as a user with access to all projects but do not gain the information or access all of the other projects besides the ones we assign them. Is there a possibility to change the script such that login is an automatic process?

body:
Just as an update: @rbinrais, @fnocera, @margaretmeehan and @armanrahman22 are working on adding a roles system to Doccano as well as a UI/APIs to manage the users and roles on each project.

I estimate the feature will be complete and ready for review some time next week.

Tagging @Hironsan and @icoxfog417 for visibility.

See https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/pull/333 for an implementation of RBAC on doccano that introduces three roles:

View ↓ / Role → | Project Admin | Annotator | Annotation Approver
-- | -- | -- | --
Me | x | x | x
Features | x | x | x
ProjectList | x | x | x
ProjectDetail | x | x | x
StatisticsAPI | x | x | x
ApproveLabelsAPI | x |   | x
LabelList | x | x | x
LabelDetail | x | x | x
DocumentList | x | x | x
DocumentDetail | x | x | x
AnnotationList | x | x | x
AnnotationDetail | x | x | x
TextUploadAPI | x |   |  
CloudUploadAPI | x |   |  
TextDownloadAPI | x |

issue.title: Cannot share annotated data among users

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
When we add a user into a project, what the user did is not shown to the admin's side(and others).

There is no way to check what the added users do except for the statistics page.

body: @icoxfog417 @Hironsan I believe this was implemented by #333
This feature is solved by #333. Thank you for the great work of @margaretmeehan  and @c-w !
